abstract: Do editorial page endorsements have any effect on election outcomes?
snippet: Do editorial page endorsements have any effect on election outcomes?
lead_paragraph: Newspaper editorial pages have been endorsing presidential candidates for well over a century. On Oct. 11, 1860, the New York Times editorial page threw its hat behind a "Mr. Lincoln, of Illinois, familiarly known as 'Old Abe,' age 51, height six feet seven, by profession Rail-Splitter."

headline.main: Political Newspaper Endorsements: History and Outcome
